page.title: 10FARMS ARABLE
page.content: Cookes Pen, Rectory & Penn farms grow Winter wheat, Winter barley & sugar beet in rotation. On Rectory Farm spring barley , peas & beans are also grown. Due to the thin soil on the north side of our sector quantity crops cannot be grown. The sugar beet is grown under contract to British Sugar Corporation, the rest of the crops are traded through specialist merchants. Cookes Pen & Penn farms cover 451 acres. Rectory Farm covers 180 acres. The soil is glacial sand & chalk. Equipment used consists of large & small tractors, combines, seed drills, ploughs, sugar beet harvesters, harrows, rollers and tractor sprayers. Irrigation water is gained from a bore hole in the ground.
